question: How many Posts and Pages can you have?

answers.answer_a: I can have 100 posts and 100 pages
answers.answer_b: Depends on the theme I'm using.
answers.answer_c: There is no limit on the number of posts or pages you can have.
answers.answer_d: There is no limit on the number of posts but I can have only certain amount of pages.
answers.answer_e: Depending on your plan, you can have a different amount of pages and posts.

question: Which of the following is a WordPress function used to execute a database query?

answers.answer_a: <?php $wpdb->run_query('query'); ?>
answers.answer_b: <?php $wpdb->fetch('query'); ?>

question: How can you restore the WordPress core files?

answers.answer_a: The core files can be downloaded back from wordpress.org site.
answers.answer_b: The core files can be downloaded back from Database.

question: What are the disadvantages of WordPress?

answers.answer_a: Only utilizes PHP
answers.answer_b: Use of multiple plugins can make the website heavy to load and slow
answers.answer_c: Modifying images and tables is difficult.

question: Which file is the single most important file in Wordpress?

answers.answer_a: header.php
answers.answer_b: wp-setting.php

question: Where is thewp_config.php file located?

answers.answer_a: Inside the wp-admin folder
answers.answer_b: Inside the wp-content folder
answers.answer_c: In the root directory of the WordPress installation

question: What is a permalink?

answers.answer_a: A popular WordPress Plugin
answers.answer_b: The numeric IP address of your WordPress site
answers.answer_c: The complete URL of your WordPress site
answers.answer_d: Permalinks are the permanent URLs to your individual pages and blog posts, as well as your category and tag archives
answers.answer_e: A permalink is the web address used to link to your content.

question: What websites can you build with WordPress?

answers.answer_a: Shop
answers.answer_b: Blog
answers.answer_c: Betting website

question: Just installed plugin crashes your Wordpress site with no access to the dashboard. What do you do?

answers.answer_a: Rename the specific plugin folder in /wp-content/plugins
answers.answer_b: Reinstall Wordpress
answers.answer_c: Delete all plugins from /wp-content/plugins folder
answers.answer_e: Rename the specific plugin folder in /wp-includes/plugins
answers.answer_f: Rename the specific plugin folder in /wp-admin/plugins

answers.answer_a: Categories allow a user to divide its content into different sections.
answers.answer_b: Categories allow a user to merge its content from different sections.
answers.answer_c: Categories allow a user to list out all the contents

question: In what case we cannot recommend WordPress to a client?

answers.answer_a: If the client is working on a non-CMS base project
answers.answer_b: If a site wants complex or innovative e-commerce

answers.answer_a: Publish Posts
answers.answer_b: Edit Pages

question: What is the name of the first page you encounter after logging into your web page?

answers.answer_a: Dashboard
answers.answer_b: Security question page
answers.answer_c: WP upgrade option

question: What is the difference between the WordPress Address and Site Address settings located in the General Settings area?

answers.answer_a: The WordPress Address is where to look for WordPress plugins, while the Site Address is what will be used as the base for creating URLs for web pages.
answers.answer_b: The WordPress Address is where to look for WordPress files, while the Site Address is what will be used as the base for creating URLs for web pages.
answers.answer_c: The WordPress Address is where to look for WordPress meta tags , while the Site Address is what will be used as the base for creating URLs for web pages.

question: Do deactivated plugins slow down a WordPress site?

answers.answer_a: Even deactivated plugins slow down your website
answers.answer_b: Deactivated do not plugins slow down your website

question: What do you mean by the custom field in WordPress?

answers.answer_a: Custom fields are also known as request meta. request meta is a feature in WordPress which allows post authors to add additional information at the time writing a post.
answers.answer_b: Custom fields are also known as post meta. Post meta is a feature in WordPress which allows post authors to add additional information at the time writing a post.
answers.answer_c: Custom fields are also known as get meta. Get meta is a feature in WordPress which allows get authors to add additional information at the time writing a post.

question: What is the best way to change table prefix (wp_) before installation in WordPress?

answers.answer_a: Before Installation: In this way, you have to rename your wp_config.php file according to your need through $table_prefix=’wp_’;.
answers.answer_b: Before Installation: Through this way, you have to go PHPMyAdmin -> Select your database -> Check all tables -> Add/Update table prefix.
answers.answer_c: After Installation: Once you have the database, you can go ahead and change it

question: What are Shortcodes in WordPress and how we can use it?

answers.answer_a: Shortcodes is a specific code that is used to do control loop.
answers.answer_b: Shortcodes is a specific code that is used to do recursion.
answers.answer_c: Shortcodes is a specific code that is used to do several tasks with less effort. Also, it is synonymous with the shortcut.

question: What is the difference between Wordpress Posts and Wordpress Pages?

answers.answer_a: There is absolutely no difference between Posts and Pages.
answers.answer_b: Posts are entries listed in reverse chronological order on the site homepage and Pages are static and are not listed by date.
answers.answer_c: Pages are entries listed in reverse chronological order on the site homepage and Posts are static and are not listed by date.

question: What is the function to get website url in wordpress?

answers.answer_a: get_website_url();
answers.answer_b: get_site_url();
answers.answer_c: get_url();

question: What are meta-tags?

answers.answer_a: Meta-tags are keywords and description used to display website or page information.
answers.answer_b: Meta-tags are codes and scripts used to display website or page information.
answers.answer_c: Meta-tags are special tages and function used to display website or page information.

question: How can you create a static page with WordPress?

answers.answer_a: To create a static page in WordPress, in the page section you have to upload a PHP file to the server in the theme folder, and then select that as your template.
answers.answer_b: To create a static page in WordPress, in the page section you have to upload a PERL file to the server in the theme folder, and then select that as your template.
answers.answer_c: To create a static page in WordPress, in the page section you have to upload a HTML file to the server in the theme folder, and then select that as your template.

question: What is the Ping of Death?

answers.answer_a: The Ping of Death is an occurrence when sending packets are reassembled, are too large for the system to understand.
answers.answer_b: The Ping of Death is capturing and deciphering traffic on a network.
answers.answer_c: The Ping of Death can be set in wordpress under admin settings.

question: What is a WordPress taxonomy?

answers.answer_a: In WordPress, a “taxonomy” is a grouping mechanism for some posts (or links or custom post types).
answers.answer_b: In WordPress, a “taxonomy” is a grouping mechanism for some plugins .
answers.answer_c: In WordPress, a “taxonomy” is a grouping mechanism for some pages .

question: Is it a good practice to edit the WordPress core files?

answers.answer_a: No, because your changes will be lost during the next WordPress update
answers.answer_b: Yes, you can change the core files without any further compilations

question: In WordPress, objects are passed by value or by reference.

answers.answer_a: In WordPress, all objects are passed by value.
answers.answer_b: In WordPress, all objects are passed by reference.

question: What are template tags in WordPress?

answers.answer_a: Template tags are used within themes to retrieve content from your database.
answers.answer_b: Template tags are used within themes to retrieve content from your folder.
answers.answer_c: Template tags are used within themes to retrieve content from your plugins.

question: Where is WordPress content stored?

answers.answer_a: WordPress stores it's content in a MySQL database on the server.
answers.answer_b: WordPress stores it's content in the wp-content folder
answers.answer_c: WordPress stores it's content in a MySQL database on the server.

question: Which ‘meta box’ is not hidden by default on Post and Page screens?

answers.answer_a: Featured Image is the meta box that is not hidden by default on Post and Page screens.
answers.answer_b: Featured Image is the child box that is hidden by default on Post and Page screens.

question: Tick all the rules which need to be followed while developing a WordPress Plugin?

answers.answer_b: Create the folder of Plugin.
answers.answer_c: Create a sub-folder for PHP files, translations, and assets.
answers.answer_e: Create the main plug-in file and fill up the header information.

question: How can you edit a WordPress comment?

answers.answer_a: You can edit WordPress comment using the command. From the panel, under the Comments option, select edit to edit a comment.
answers.answer_b: You can edit WordPress comment using the dashboard. From the panel, under the Comments option, select edit to edit a comment.
answers.answer_c: You can edit WordPress comment using the profile. From the panel, under the Comments option, select edit to edit a comment.

answers.answer_b: MIT license

question: How many types of plans are available in wordpress by default?
What is an action hook?

answers.answer_a: A hook that is triggered at a specific time when WordPress is running and lets you take an action.
answers.answer_b: A hook that is triggered at a specific time when WordPress is not running so it lets you take an action.

question: What is the correct syntax of the usermeta function in Wordpress?

answers.answer_a: get_user( int $user_id, string $key = '', bool $single = true )
answers.answer_b: get_user_meta( int $user_id, string $key = '', bool $single = false )
answers.answer_c: get_user_meta( int $user_id, string $key = '', bool $single = true )

question: What should one use for plugin development — custom post types or custom database tables?

answers.answer_a: custom post type
answers.answer_b: custom database tables
answers.answer_c: There is no specific preference for plugin development; it depends on what type of plugin’s one has to develop.

question: What are Importers in WordPress?

answers.answer_a: Importers are linking files that provide the functionality to export a bulk XML file with any number of records.
answers.answer_b: Importers are plugins that provide the functionality to import a bulk XML file with any number of records.

question: Where in Wordpress can you discourage search engines from indexing this site?

answers.answer_a: From the Plugins Section
answers.answer_b: From the Tools->Export Section
answers.answer_c: From the Users Section

question: How do you enable debug mode in WP?

answers.answer_a: You can enable debug mode in WP by editing wp-config.php file and changing WP_DEBUG constant value to true
answers.answer_b: You can enable debug mode in WP by editing wp-config.html file and changing WP_DEBUG constant value to true

question: Which of the listed actions and filter hooks are functions in WordPress?

answers.answer_a: has_filter() and has_action()
answers.answer_b: apply_filters_ref_array() and do_action_ref_array()
answers.answer_c: doing_filter() and doing_action()
